measured_by: Japanese version of the Ten-Item Personality Inventory (TIPI-J)
justification: The study assessed the Big Five personality traits using the TIPI-J scale, which includes two items representing each of the five personality factors: Extraversion, Agreeableness, Conscientiousness, Neuroticism, and Openness.

measured_by: Japanese version of the Brief Self-Control Scale (BSCS-J)
justification: Self-control was measured using the BSCS-J, which consists of 16 items, including nine reverse-scored items. This scale assesses self-control on a 5-point Likert scale.

measured_by: Japanese version of the Promotion/Prevention Focus Scale
justification: Promotion and prevention regulatory focus were measured using the Promotion/Prevention Focus Scale, which comprises 16 items, eight for each focus (promotion and prevention).

measured_by: Japanese version of the International Physical Activity Questionnaire Short Form (IPAQ-SF)
justification: PA levels were assessed using the IPAQ-SF, which evaluates walking, moderate-intensity activity, and vigorous-intensity activity categories, based on frequency and duration over an average week.
